course_title: Applied Linear Algebra and Big Data 001
course_title_2023: Applied Linear Algebra and Big Data
best_gem_comment: this class is a great overview of some very applicable algorithms, but it's not such a perfect gem as previous years may have implied. the psets rely heavily on matlab starter code that you have to modify, and unless you're already a pro at matlab and can write these algorithms from scratch, the pset process often becomes trying to modify matlab code and random bugs. best resources are office hours and the textbook (literally every answer you'll ever need is in that book). love this class for the toolbox of algorithms and eli (an actual gem of a human being), but if you're more interested in the "math" of the applied math, may suggest going somewhere else. this class is definitely very applied, with a good portion being memorization. overall okay class, but I might decide to stay clear of the AM concentration after this.
